Weakness.Name: Effectiveness
Weakness.Description: Issues that prevent the achievement of goals.

Weakness.Name: Ambiguous Goal Definition
Weakness.Description: The user does not understand the goal.

Weakness.Name: Insufficient Feedback
Weakness.Description: The system does not clearly indicate the current state of the system.

Weakness.Name: Invisible System State (JD1)
Weakness.Description: The user does not know what to do next.

Weakness.Name: Efficiency
Weakness.Description: Issues that increase the time and effort required to perform a task.

Weakness.Name: Redundant Workflow Steps
Weakness.Description: More steps are required than necessary.

Weakness.Name: Ineffecient Information Access (JD10)
Weakness.Description: It takes time to find the information you need.

Weakness.Name: Lack of Shortcuts (JD7)
Weakness.Description: Not sure of available shortcuts.

Weakness.Name: High response latency
Weakness.Description: High response latency causes inefficiencies and frustrates users.

Weakness.Name: Satisfaction
Weakness.Description: Factors that cause discomfort and confusion when using the system.

Weakness.Name: Stressful Error Notification
Weakness.Description: Error notifications are unfriendly or aggressive.

Weakness.Name: Cluttered User Interface (JD8)
Weakness.Description: Too much information and functionality is crammed into the system.

Weakness.Name: Lack of Intuitive Design (JD6)
Weakness.Description: Users cannot understand how to use it naturally.

Weakness.Name: Exposure of Internal States
Weakness.Description: Exposure of overly complex internal states or structure to the interface

Weakness.Name: Error Handling (JD9)
Weakness.Description: Design issues that encourage users to make errors or make recovery difficult.

Weakness.Name: Misleading Error Messages
Weakness.Description: The user misunderstands the cause of the issues.

Weakness.Name: Lack of Error Prevention (JD5)
Weakness.Description: There is no mechanism to prevent input or selection errors.

Weakness.Name: Lack of Recoverability (JD3)
Weakness.Description: Cannot easily recover from errors.

Weakness.Name: Accessibility
Weakness.Description: Designed to be difficult to use for certain user groups (e.g., visually impaired, novices).

Weakness.Name: Lack of Visual Accessibility Features
Weakness.Description: Contrast too low, no alternative text.

Weakness.Name: Restricted Keyboard Navigation
Weakness.Description: Difficult to operate with just a keyboard.

Weakness.Name: Lack of Multilingual Support
Weakness.Description: Insufficient multilingual support.

Weakness.Name: Consistency and Standards (JD4)
Weakness.Description: The issue of UI design being contrary to industry standards and internal consistency.

Weakness.Name: Inconsistent Terminology (JD2)
Weakness.Description: They use different names for the same concept.

Weakness.Name: Ignoring Standard Design Guidelines
Weakness.Description: Ignores industry standards (e.g., material design).

Weakness.Name: Unpredictable Behavior
Weakness.Description: System behaves in an unexpected way.

Weakness.Name: Inconsistent User Interface
Weakness.Description: Bind different interface for each subject.
